intro: Liparia crassinervia, commonly known as the broad-veined liparia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the family. Liparia crassinervia thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological studies and horticultural cultivation.
